title: Adventure Paths

properties.name: description
properties.value: Adventure Paths are a task system intended to help new players get on their feet by completing tasks for various low level rewards. Players will only be eligible for Adventure Paths if they've told the Gielinor Guide at the very beginning of Tutorial Island that they are either a new player or are a player that has played in the past, but not recently. In addition, players who choose to play Ironman Mode are not eligible.

content:
"Starter kit" redirects here. For the box of items obtained from Adventurer Jon, see Combat path starter kit.
For more information for new players, see New player guide.
The Adventure Paths overview, showing the different available paths and the player's progress.

Adventure Paths are a task system intended to help new players get on their feet by completing tasks for various low level rewards. Players will only be eligible for Adventure Paths if they've told the Gielinor Guide at the very beginning of Tutorial Island that they are either a new player or are a player that has played in the past, but not recently. In addition, players who choose to play Ironman Mode are not eligible.

The task system currently has two path available at the same time: the Combat Path, with a total of 15 tasks, and the Gatherer Path, with three tasks (one per skill).

Combat Path[edit | edit source]

Viewing a task in the Combat Path.

The Combat Path involves levelling up the player's combat skills to a certain level. Beginning the Combat Path rewards players with a combat path starter kit.

Players who complete the Combat Path can receive a combat path voucher from Adventurer Jon, which can be used to claim various rewards from NPCs in Varrock; members receive both the Free to play reward and the Members reward.

Name Task Free-to-play reward Members reward
Getting started with Attack Reach level 5 in the Attack skill. Steel longsword Coins (500)
Getting a grip on it Reach level 10 in the Attack skill. Black longsword Coins (500)
Weapons master Reach level 20 in the Attack skill. Mithril longsword Coins (1000)
Getting started with Strength Reach level 5 in the Strength skill. Trout (5)
Leather gloves
Leather boots 		Trout (10)
Strength potion(4)
Building muscle Reach level 10 in the Strength skill. Trout (5)
Strength potion(4) 		Trout (10)
Strength potion(4) (2)
Body builder Reach level 20 in the Strength skill. Salmon (20)
strength potion(4) (2) 		Coins (500)
Amulet of strength
Strength potion(4) (5)
Getting started with Defence Reach level 5 in the Defence skill. Steel med helm Steel kiteshield
Sticks and stones Reach level 10 in the Defence skill. Steel chainbody Steel platelegs
Mithril defence Reach level 20 in the Defence skill. Mithril chainbody Mithril full helm
Mithril platelegs
Mithril kiteshield
Getting started with Ranged Reach level 5 in the Ranged skill. Leather cowl
Bronze arrows (150) 		Leather chaps
Honing my aim Reach level 10 in the Ranged skill. Oak shortbow
Bronze arrows (350) 		Leather body
Sharpshooter Reach level 20 in the Ranged skill. Willow shortbow
Iron arrows (75)
coif 		Studded chaps
Iron arrows (100)
Getting started with Magic Reach level 5 in the Magic skill. Staff of air
Mind rune (50)
Water rune (75) 		Body rune (35)
Striking a pose Reach level 10 in the Magic skill. Staff of earth
Mind rune (250)
Air rune (250) 		Cosmic rune (35)
Bringer of chaos Reach level 20 in the Magic skill. Staff of fire
Mind rune (300)
Air rune (300) 		Chaos rune (35)
Amulet of magic

Gatherer Path[edit | edit source]

Viewing a task in the Gatherer Path.

The Gatherer Path involves levelling up the player's gathering skills to a certain level.

Players who complete the Gatherer Path can receive a lamp of the gatherer from Adventurer Jon which when rubbed grants 150 experience in either Woodcutting, Fishing or Mining.

Name Task Free to play reward Members reward
Getting started with Fishing Reach level 5 in the Fishing skill. Fishing rod
fishing bait (100) 		N/A
Getting started with Woodcutting Reach level 5 in the Woodcutting skill. Iron axe
logs (20) 		N/A
Getting started with Mining Reach level 5 in the Mining skill. Iron pickaxe
tin ore (20)
copper ore (20) 		N/A

In addition, players who choose to play [[Ironman Mode]] are not eligible.
